The English rudiments of the Latine tongue, explained by question and answer. VVhich are so formed, that a childe, omitting altogether the questions, may learn onely the answers, and bee fully instructed in the rudiments of the Latine tongue. / By William Du-Gard. For the use of Marchant-Tailor's School. Dugard, William, 1606-1662.
[8], 93, [51] p.
Printed by W.D. and are to bee sold by Francis Eglesfield at the Marigold in Paul's Church-yard., London: : An. Do. 1656.
Annotation on Thomason copy: "Marsh 27:. Reproduction of the original in the British Library. Includes index.
=======
